title.narrative: Mechanism 13868 - Health Communication & Marketing (HCM)

description.narrative:
Additional detail on PEPFAR financial information and terminology can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/financial. The PEPFAR IATI activity file and PEPFAR IATI Activity File User's Guide can be found at https://data.pepfar.gov/additionalData
HCM will implement condom social marketing, distribution of GOK free condoms, and Social Behavior Change Campaigns (SBCC) activities to promote safer sexual behaviors at the national level. HCM will support MOH in quantification and forecasting of condoms and advocate for improved segmentation of condom distribution. SBCC through mass media and interpersonal communication to address consistent con Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.15: Biomedical Prevention - Medical Male Circumcision. Policy, training, outreach, message development, service delivery, quality assurance, and equipment and commodities related to male circumcision (MC). Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.6: Adult Care and Support. All facility-based and home/community-based activities for HIV-infected adults and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.12: Laboratory Infrastructure. Development and strengthening of laboratory systems and facilities to support HIV/AIDSrelated activities including purchase of equipment and commodities and provision of quality assurance, staff training and other technical assistance. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.11: Treatment/Adult Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.2: Sexual Prevention - Abstinence/Be Faithful. Activities (including training) to promote abstinence, fidelity, reducing multiple and concurrent partners, and related social and community norms that impact these behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.9: Counseling and Testing. Includes activities in which both HIV counseling and testing are provided for those who seek to know their HIV status (as in traditional VCT) or provider initiated counseling and testing. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.5: Sexual Prevention - Other Sexual Prevention. Other activities (including training) aimed at preventing HIV transmission including purchase and promotion of condoms, STI management (if not in palliative care settings/context), messages/programs to reduce other risks of persons engaged in high-risk behaviors. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.7: TB/HIV. Includes exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, treatment and prevention of tuberculosis (including medication), as well as screening and referral of TB clinic clients for HIV testing and clinical care. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.1: Preventing Mother-to-Child Transmission (PMTCT). Activities (including training) aimed at preventing mother-to-child HIV transmission, including ARV prophylaxis for HIV-infected pregnant women and newborns and counseling and support for maternal nutrition. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.17: Pediatric Care and Support. All health facility-based care for HIV-exposed children and their families aimed at extending and optimizing quality of life for HIV-infected clients and their families throughout the continuum of illness through provision of clinical, psychological, spiritual, social and prevention services. Funds allocated for Program Element HL.1.18: Treatment/Pediatric Treatment. Including infrastructure, training clinicians and other providers, exams, clinical monitoring, related laboratory services, and community-adherence activities. objectives

HCM will implement condom social marketing, distribution of GOK free condoms, and Social Behavior Change Campaigns (SBCC) activities to promote safer sexual behaviors at the national level. HCM will support MOH in quantification and forecasting of condoms and advocate for improved segmentation of condom distribution. SBCC through mass media and interpersonal communication to address consistent condom use and condom use in concurrency will be implemented. HTC and VMMC services will be provided through the Gold Star Network, Tunza and Huduma Poa social franchises. A referral mechanism will be strengthened to ensure that individuals who test HIV positive are referred and linked to care and treatment. Uptake of VMMC and HTC will be promoted through SBCC. HCM will introduce eMTCT interventions in selected Tunza facilities that are already offering ARVs and maternal child health services. Through the Tunza sites a pediatric care package will be implemented. ART services will be integrated and strengthened through the review of provider competencies. Providers with significant deficiencies in knowledge and skills will be trained. HCM activities target males 15 years and above with VMMC services, couples and general population with being faithful and condom use in concurrent relationships, HTC, care and ART services. HCM will provide training and TA to the Health Promotion Unit and USG partners to ensure sustained involvement in the development of campaigns. To ensure quality of services, HCM will strengthen the franchise network; assess the medical detailing program and review provider accreditation. A project monitoring and evaluation plan will be used to evaluate the project activities. $6,276,470 funding will be provided with $4,074,010 for FY14 and $2,202,460 in FY15.

policy-marker.narrative: The U.S. President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief (PEPFAR) is the U.S. government's response to the global HIV/AIDS epidemic and represents the largest commitment by any nation to address a single disease in history.
